events.message: The customer reported a rear-end collision with their vehicle at a stoplight, requesting to file a claim immediately.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report describing a car collision involving two vehicles.
Assigned claims agent contacted the customer to discuss the accident and guide them through the next steps of the claim process.
The claim was officially acknowledged by the insurer, and the customer was assured that the case would be processed promptly.
Insurance agent requested detailed police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a copy of the driver's license to proceed with investigation.
Customer successfully submitted all required documents including police report and photographs, facilitating timely progress of the claim.
The claims department began a thorough investigation into the collision details, verifying facts and reviewing liability coverage.
The investigation concluded that the other driver was at fault for the rear-end collision, validating the customer's claim.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering full repairs and a rental car during the repair period at no additional cost.
The customer responded positively expressing appreciation for the quick offer and clear communication from the insurance agent.
Claim approval was granted based on the investigation results and customer acceptance of the proposed settlement terms.
The agreed settlement amount was paid directly to the repair shop to expedite vehicle repairs following the accident.
All claim activities were completed and the case was formally closed after confirming the vehicle repairs were done satisfactorily.
